content:
GenerateApplicationManifest Class

In this Article

Implements the GenerateApplicationManifest task. Use the GenerateApplicationManifest element in the project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see GenerateApplicationManifest Task.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class GenerateApplicationManifest : Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateManifestBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • Task
  • Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateManifestBase
  • GenerateApplicationManifest

Remarks

EntryPoint is an optional ITaskItem[] parameter that indicates the entry point for the generated manifest assembly. For a ClickOnce deployment manifest, this input specifies the ClickOnce application manifest.

In Visual Studio 2005, the GenerateApplicationManifest Task requires an EntryPoint when an application manifest is generated. (Assembly or native manifests do not require an EntryPoint.) This requirement is enforced by the build error "MSB3185: EntryPoint not specified for manifest."

In Visual Studio 2008, MSBuild does not issue this error when the EntryPoint task parameter is not specified. Instead, the <customHostSpecified> tag is inserted as a child of the <entryPoint> tag, for example, as follows. 

<entryPoint xmlns="urn:schemas-   
  microsoft-com:asm.v2">  
    <co.v1:customHostSpecified />  
</entryPoint>

You can add DLL dependencies to the application manifest by using the following steps:

  1. Resolve the references in the assembly by using a call to ResolveAssemblyReference.

  2. Pass the output of the previous task and the assembly itself to ResolveManifestFiles.

  3. Pass the dependencies by using the Dependencies parameter to GenerateApplicationManifest.

Constructors summary

GenerateApplicationManifest()

Initializes a new instance of the GenerateApplicationManifest class.

Properties summary

ClrVersion

Gets or sets the minimum version of the Common Language Runtime (CLR) required by the application.
ConfigFile

Gets or sets the task item that contains the application configuration file.
Dependencies

Gets or sets an item list that defines the set of dependent assemblies for the generated manifest.
ErrorReportUrl

Gets or sets the URL of the Web page that is displayed in dialog boxes during ClickOnce installations.
FileAssociations

Gets or sets a list of one or more file type that are associated with the ClickOnce deployment manifest. File associations only valid only when .NET Framework 3.5 or later is targeted.
Files

Gets or sets the full paths of files to include in the manifest.
HostInBrowser

Gets or sets whether the application is hosted in a browser (as are WPF Web Browser Applications).
IconFile

Gets or sets the application's icon file.
IsolatedComReferences

Gets or sets COM components to isolate in the generated manifest.
ManifestType

Gets or sets the type of manifest to generate.
OSVersion

Gets or sets the operating system (OS) version that is the minimum required by the application.
Product

Specifies the ProductName property in the project file.
Publisher

Specifies the PublisherName property in the project file.
RequiresMinimumFramework35SP1

Gets or sets whether the application requires the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1.
SuiteName

Gets or sets the name of the folder on the Start menu where the application is located after ClickOnce deployment.
SupportUrl

Specifies the SupportUrl property in the project file.
TargetFrameworkProfile

Gets or sets the target framework profile.
TargetFrameworkSubset

Gets or sets the name of the .NET Framework subset to target.
TrustInfoFile

Gets or sets an XML document that specifies the application security.
UseApplicationTrust

Specifies whether the crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.Product*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.Publisher*, and crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.SupportUrl* properties are written to the application manifest.

Methods summary

GetObjectType()
OnManifestLoaded(Manifest)
OnManifestResolved(Manifest)
ValidateInputs()

Constructors

  • GenerateApplicationManifest()

    Initializes a new instance of the GenerateApplicationManifest class.

    public GenerateApplicationManifest ();

Properties

  • ClrVersion

    Gets or sets the minimum version of the Common Language Runtime (CLR) required by the application.

    public string ClrVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The minimum version of the CLR required by the application.

    Remarks

    By default, the value is the CLR version in use by the build system. If the task is generating a native manifest, this property is ignored.

  • ConfigFile

    Gets or sets the task item that contains the application configuration file.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem ConfigFile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem

      The task item that contains the application configuration file.

    Remarks

    If the task is generating a native manifest, this property is ignored.

  • Dependencies

    Gets or sets an item list that defines the set of dependent assemblies for the generated manifest.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] Dependencies { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      An item list of dependent assembly names.

    Remarks

    Each item may be further described by item metadata to indicate additional deployment state and the kind of dependence.

  • ErrorReportUrl

    Gets or sets the URL of the Web page that is displayed in dialog boxes during ClickOnce installations.

    public string ErrorReportUrl { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that represents the URL of a Web page.

    Remarks

    Specifies a Web page to be displayed in dialog boxes that are displayed during ClickOnce installations.

  • FileAssociations

    Gets or sets a list of one or more file type that are associated with the ClickOnce deployment manifest. File associations only valid only when .NET Framework 3.5 or later is targeted.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] FileAssociations { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      A list of file types that are associated with the generated manifest.

    Remarks

    File types can be custom. The following is an example of a <fileAssociation> Element (ClickOnce Application): 

    <FileAssociation Include=".nyt">  
    <ProgId>NewYorkTimes.Document</ProgId>  
    <DefaultIcon>nyt.ico</DefaultIcon>  
    <Description>New York Times Reader document</Description>  
</FileAssociation>
  • Files

    Gets or sets the full paths of files to include in the manifest.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] Files { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      Paths to files that are included in the manifest.

  • HostInBrowser

    Gets or sets whether the application is hosted in a browser (as are WPF Web Browser Applications).

    public bool HostInBrowser { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      A Boolean value that indicates whether the application being deployed will be hosted in a browser (true), or not (false). true only applies to WPF Web Browser Applications.

    Remarks

    For project types other than WPF Web Browser Applications, set HostInBrowser to false (the default value).

    When you deploy a WPF Web Browser Application, you must set the HostInBrowser property to true. This causes the <hostInBrowser> tag to be added to the generated application manifest, enabling ClickOnce to deploy projects for browser-hosted applications, which contain .xbap files.

    You also have to make the application available online only by setting Install to false. If this condition is not met, you will receive MSBuild Error MSB3116.

  • IconFile

    Gets or sets the application's icon file.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem IconFile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem

      The icon file to use for the application.

    Remarks

    The application icon is expressed in the generated application manifest and is used on the Start menu and in the Uninstall or change a program dialog box. If this input is not specified, a default icon is used. If the task is generating a native manifest, this property is ignored.

  • IsolatedComReferences

    Gets or sets COM components to isolate in the generated manifest.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] IsolatedComReferences { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The COM components to isolate in the generated manifest.

    Remarks

    This property lets you isolate COM components for "Registration Free COM" deployment. It works by auto-generating a manifest that has standard COM registration definitions. The COM components must be registered on the build computer.

  • ManifestType

    Gets or sets the type of manifest to generate.

    public string ManifestType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The kind of manifest to generate.

    Remarks

    This property can have the following values:

    • Native

    • ClickOnce

      If this property is not specified, the task defaults to ClickOnce.

  • OSVersion

    Gets or sets the operating system (OS) version that is the minimum required by the application.

    public string OSVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The OS version that is the minimum required by the application.

    Remarks

    For example, the value "5.1.2600.0" indicates that the operating system is Windows XP. If this property is not specified, the value "4.10.0.0" is used. This indicates Windows 98 Second Edition, which is the minimum supported operating system for the .NET Framework.

    If the task is generating a native manifest, this input is ignored.

  • Product

    Specifies the ProductName property in the project file.

    public string Product { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that corresponds to the ProductName property in the project file.

    Remarks

    This property corresponds to the ProductName property in the project file. The default value is null. If ProductName is null and UseApplicationTrust is true, the RegisteredOrganization value in the registry is written to the application manifest. If RegisteredOrganization is also null, the assembly name is used.

  • Publisher

    Specifies the PublisherName property in the project file.

    public string Publisher { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that corresponds to the PublisherName property in the project file.

    Remarks

    This property corresponds to the PublisherName property in the project file. The default value is null. If PublisherName is null and UseApplicationTrust is true, the assembly name is written to the application manifest.

  • RequiresMinimumFramework35SP1

    Gets or sets whether the application requires the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1.

    public bool RequiresMinimumFramework35SP1 { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the application requires .NET Framework 3.5 SP1; false otherwise.

  • SuiteName

    Gets or sets the name of the folder on the Start menu where the application is located after ClickOnce deployment.

    public string SuiteName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that represents the name of a Start menu folder.

  • SupportUrl

    Specifies the SupportUrl property in the project file.

    public string SupportUrl { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that corresponds to the SupportUrl property in the project file.

    Remarks

    This property corresponds to the SupportUrl property in the project file. The default value is null. If SupportUrl is null and UseApplicationTrust is true, an empty string is written to the application manifest.

  • TargetFrameworkProfile

    Gets or sets the target framework profile.

    public string TargetFrameworkProfile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the target framework profile.

  • TargetFrameworkSubset

    Gets or sets the name of the .NET Framework subset to target.

    public string TargetFrameworkSubset { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the .NET Framework subset.

  • TrustInfoFile

    Gets or sets an XML document that specifies the application security.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem TrustInfoFile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem

      The XML document that specifies the application security.

    Remarks

    The root element in the XML document must be a trustInfo node in the asm.v2 namespace. If the task is generating a native manifest, this property is ignored.

  • UseApplicationTrust

    Specifies whether the crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.Product*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.Publisher*, and crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.SupportUrl* properties are written to the application manifest.

    public bool UseApplicationTrust { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      A Boolean value that indicates whether the crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.Product*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.Publisher*, and crosoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateApplicationManifest.SupportUrl* properties are written to the application manifest (true). If the value is false, these properties are ignored.

    Remarks

    The Product, Publisher, and SupportUrl properties default to null. These properties are only used if UseApplicationTrust is true; if so, the values of these properties are written to the corresponding tags in the application manifest.

    If UseApplicationTrust is false (the default value), these properties are ignored.

Methods

  • GetObjectType()
    protected override Type GetObjectType ();

    Returns

    • Type

      To be added.

  • OnManifestLoaded(Manifest)
    protected override bool OnManifestLoaded (Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.Manifest manifest);

    Parameters

    • manifest
      Manifest

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      To be added.

  • OnManifestResolved(Manifest)
    protected override bool OnManifestResolved (Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.Manifest manifest);

    Parameters

    • manifest
      Manifest

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      To be added.

  • ValidateInputs()
    protected override bool ValidateInputs ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      To be added.
